item.title: PostgreSQL flaw exploited as zero-day in BeyondTrust breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Rapid7's vulnerability research team says attackers exploited a PostgreSQL security flaw as a zero-day to breach the network of privileged access management company BeyondTrust in December. [...]

item.title: Chinese hackers breach more US telecoms via unpatched Cisco routers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: China's Salt Typhoon hackers are still actively targeting telecoms worldwide and have breached more U.S. telecommunications providers via unpatched Cisco IOS XE network devices. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes bug causing Windows Server 2025 boot errors
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has fixed a known issue causing "boot device inaccessible" errors during startup on some Windows Server 2025 systems using iSCSI. [...]

item.title: whoAMI attacks give hackers code execution on Amazon EC2 instances
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Security researchers discovered a name confusion attack that allows access to an Amazon Web Services account to anyone that publishes an Amazon Machine Image (AMI) with a specific name. [...]

item.title: Dutch Police seizes 127 XHost servers, dismantles bulletproof hoster
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Dutch Police (Politie) dismantled the ZServers/XHost bulletproof hosting operation after taking offline 127 servers used by the illegal platform. [...]

item.title: Hacker leaks account data of 12 million Zacks Investment users
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Zacks Investment Research (Zacks) last year reportedly suffered another data breach that exposed sensitive information related to roughly 12 million accounts. [...]

item.title: Chinese espionage tools deployed in RA World ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A China-based threat actor, tracked as Emperor Dragonfly and commonly associated with cybercriminal endeavors, has been observed using in a ransomware attack a toolset previously attributed to espionage actors. [...]

item.title: zkLend loses $9.5M in crypto heist, asks hacker to return 90%
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Decentralized money lender zkLend suffered a breach where threat actors exploited a smart contract flaw to steal 3,600 Ethereum, worth $9.5 million at the time. [...]

item.title: Surge in attacks exploiting old ThinkPHP and ownCloud flaws
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Increased hacker activity has been observed in attempts to compromise poorly maintained devices that are vulnerable to older security issues from 2022 and 2023. [...]

item.title: Sarcoma ransomware claims breach at giant PCB maker Unimicron
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A relatively new ransomware operation named 'Sarcoma' has claimed responsibility for an attack against the Unimicron printed circuit boards (PCB) maker in Taiwan. [...]

item.title: DPRK hackers dupe targets into typing PowerShell commands as admin
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: North Korean state actor 'Kimsuky' (aka 'Emerald Sleet' or 'Velvet Chollima') has been observed using a new tactic inspired from the now widespread ClickFix campaigns. [...]

item.title: Ivanti fixes three critical flaws in Connect Secure & Policy Secure
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Ivanti has released security updates for Ivanti Connect Secure (ICS), Ivanti Policy Secure (IPS), and Ivanti Secure Access Client (ISAC) to address multiple vulnerabilities, including three critical severity problems. [...]
